column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Awareness of the reduction of non-renewable sources increased , and there is a desire for a more sustainable environment .
#Text=Due to the tightening legislation in the European Union ( EU ) , more resource-efficient and sustainable waste management is required .
#Text=Polymer composites are one alternative for recycling materials or utilizing side-streams which otherwise would be discarded .
#Text=A wide range of materials were used for this purpose , such as rice straw , deinked newspaper , and chicken feather fibers .
#Text=One way to classify fillers in polymers is to divide them into two classes : organic and inorganic .
#Text=Several incentives guided the utilization of these waste materials .

#Text=Mineral fillers were used to decrease the price of plastic , and natural fibers as fillers in plastic enhance material properties and give a more environmentally friendly characteristic to the material .
#Text=Mineral fillers increase the stiffness and the flame retardancy of plastic , for example .
#Text=Using recycled materials instead of virgin ones makes the use of the filler even more meaningful , from the environmental point of view .
#Text=The study of using different waste fractions as fillers for polymers increased in recent years .
#Text=Different materials from various fields were tested .
#Text=One of the most often studied areas is natural fiber polymer composites .
#Text=Various types of fibers from different parts of a plant can be used as a filler .
#Text=Several studies were conducted , for example , on paper mill sludge that was utilized as a filler in a polymer .
#Text=Primary sludge can also be utilized as a material for energy production .
#Text=Recycled cellulose was also a topic of research .
#Text=One group of materials utilized in this study is side-streams from the insulation industry .
#Text=Mineral-based materials as fillers in polymer composites are not studied as much as natural fiber products .
#Text=Usually , mineral wool is used as a recycled material , not a virgin one as in this case .
#Text=For high-quality raw material , mineral wool has to be separated properly from other construction and demolition ( C&D ) waste .
#Text=Väntsi and Kärki used recycled mineral wood as a filler in a wood – plastic composite .
#Text=Rock wool waste was used in the manufacturing of a cement-based composite .
#Text=The last material used in this study was waste from a powder coating factory .
#Text=This type of material is quite a new area of research , but Souza et al. studied composite manufacturing using ink waste as an adhesive .
#Text=With these materials , it was possible to manufacture more environmentally friendly products , without using virgin materials as much .
#Text=In this study , six different composites were manufactured by using fillers from industrial side-streams .
#Text=The purpose of the study was to investigate how the selected filler materials change the mechanical properties of polymer composites .
#Text=Materials selected for this study are underutilized ; thus , this research has the potential to bring new application fields for materials that are not effectively used at this moment .
#Text=Side-streams from different industries create a steady material flow with uniform quality that has the potential to be utilized as a filler in polymer composites .
